page.title: 14Babbinswood Farm Whittington
page.content: {Babbinswood Farm}belongs to{Mr. and {Mrs.T.B.Jones.}They own 120 cattle which produce about 2000 litres of milk every day.Two milktankers come daily to collect the milk.The parlour is cleaned after every milking and so is the shed where the cows line up for milking. Some cows are dry and they have blue dye on their legs.All the cows have names and numbers on their buttocks.The breeds of cows are Friesian,Limosin and Hereford.In the yard there is a Lagoon where they put all the waste cow manure that is scraped out of the sheds.Mr.Jones has a computer in the farmhouse which controls the feeding.Cows wear yellow neckbands so that when an animal puts its head into the feeding box,a sensor signals the computer which releases the required amount of food.
